greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) = reciprocal of k modulo Prime(n), for 1 <= k < Prime(n).
comment: T(n,k) = smallest m such that k * m = 1 (mod Prime(n)). Prime(n) is the n-th prime: A000040(n).
link: Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4181 (primes less than 200)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Modular Inverse
example: Table begins for the first nine primes 2,3,5,7,11,13,17,19,23:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := ModularInverse[k, Prime[n]]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, Prime[n]-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 08 2017 *)
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 20 2006
